poem:
"Veil Over Medellín"

In Medellín's alleys, death waits
Unseen, until unwelcome guests fall prey.
Hearts ablaze, seeking the unknown, yet, the city responds,
sombre, cryptic, draped in mourning.
Five souls untied from earth's tether, 
an echo on the cobblestone
met with heavy toll.
Men of many nations lost, not in battle,
But in this dance of love's cruel riddle,
Under Colombia's indifferent, sprawling sky.
